page.title: 08Education. Government.
page.content: {Mr. Offer writes about Secondary {School Selection. } For 4th Year Junior children at Downton there is uncertainty as to which secondary school they will be going to. Unlike 95% of children of their age in England and Wales, our area has a 'selective' system which places children, according to their academic ability, in their next school,(11+.) 4th Years have to practice for two special Verbal Reasoning Tests; the average mark of these papers is added to the Head's Scaled Assessment which has to take into account the standard of their school work.
